main.name: Dan Carmody
main.description: Currently searching for a full time position.
main.bio: Just your everday developer with a love for coding, passion for development, and an appreciation for creative problem solving.
main.contactMessage: Have a project for me? Think I'd be a good fit for your team? I'd love to hear from you, give me a shout by email or by using the form below if you'd like to get in contact with me.

resume.skillsmessage: I'm always excited to learn and work with new technologies, but here are some that I have particularly enjoyed:

education.degree: Bachelors of Science in Software Engineering

work.company: Laboratory of Energy And Powered Solutions
work.description: Developed a full stack simulation environment that illustrated the interconnections of power and water networks.
Creating a digital platform for the organization Local Language Access.

Projects.title: Resiliency Infrastructure Simulation Environment
Projects.description: Single page, full stack, application that allows users to create, simulate, and study how power and water networks interact and influence one another.

Projects.title: Hachi Ramen Website
Projects.description: A sample website based on the resturant Hachi Ramen.

Projects.title: Dynamic Drag and Drop Board
Projects.description: Utilizing react-beautiful-dnd features to create a dynamic board for setting rewards across different columns, saving current state, and reloading previous state.

Projects.title: Language Policy Database
Projects.description: Database application that pulls information from ProPublica Congress API and sorts bills based on language rights and accessibility.

skills.name: Git
skills.description: I use git for all of my projects, it is my go to tool to use for version control and have used to delve into Open Source Projects.

skills.name: ReactJS
skills.description: React has fast become one of my favorite and most common tools used for front end development. All of my current projects have used it as a based and I look forward to continuing to learn and master it.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: python has become the language I use most for backend development as well as what I am most comfortable using for data-structure and algorithim programming.

skills.name: JavaScript
skills.description: Acts as my primary front end development language choice. I've come to love the number of frameworks libraries for javascript and the incredible things capable with them.

skills.name: Flask
skills.description: Microframework for python that offers a fast and easy solution for setting up a webapplications.

skills.name: Netlify
skills.description: Tool of choice for hosting my serverless applications and static webpages.

skills.name: Photoshop
skills.description: Photoshop is my main tool used for image editing for content I use.

skills.name: Illustrator
skills.description: Illustrator on the other hand is my go to tool for vector graphics and creating scalable logos and designs

skills.name: InDesign
skills.description: Lastly, indesign has become my prefered way to create fast and clean blueprints for how I want to set up and design sites and applications.
